page.title: 01BLACKMORE VALE DAIRY FARMING
page.content: This area of excellent grasslands which supports many dairy farms lies in N.E Dorset between the villages of Stalbridge and Sturminster Newton in the centre of the Blackmore Vale, Thomas Hardy's Vale of Milk.Stalbridge has the nearest church,school,shops and post-office.Sturminster a calf market and cheese factory. Originally part of the royal hunting forest of Gillingham the area was slow to be cleared and settled.The name Blackmore/moor shows that for ages the land was dark and wet but as improve- ments were made the alluvial soil proved to be very fertile and,together with a good rainfall grew superb grass The water meadows of the small river and 2 brooks easily flood and are little use.Stalbridge Weston hamlet and a big house are built on high land The area is thinly populated.
